intro: Ajuga lanata, commonly known as woolly bugloss, is a perennial herb native to Europe and western Asia. It features upright, branching stems covered in soft, fuzzy hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, woolly hairs, contributing to its common name. Ajuga lanata is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in various conditions.
